conclusion: The horizontal conveyor belt is moving clockwise at a speed of v=6 m/s. The distance between the two drive wheels M and N is L1=10 m. An object with mass m=3 kg is placed on the conveyor belt directly above wheel M. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the conveyor belt is μ=0.3.

premise: The frictional force f acting on the object is given by f = μ mg.
The acceleration a of the object due to this frictional force is a = f/m.
The object starts from rest and accelerates to the speed v = 6 m/s. The time t taken to reach this speed is t = v/a.
The distance d traveled by the object while accelerating is given by d = 1/2 a t².
The total distance between M and N is L1 = 10 m. The remaining distance d_remaining after the object reaches the speed of the conveyor belt is d_remaining = L1 - d.
The work done by the frictional force W is given by W = f × d_remaining.
